About Ideas Articles Projects

Alfredo De la Fuente

Passionate learner, eclectic idealist
'Nothing is built on stone, all is built on sand; but we must build as if the sand were stone.'
– Jorge Luis Borges

I received my MSc (with Distinction) in Statistical Learning Theory from Skoltech and Higher School of Economics, supervised by Maxim Panov. I worked on unsupervised graph embedding as member of the Structural Learning Group.

My research interests currently lie within Representation Learning, Statistical learning theory, Generative Models and Reinforcement Learning. My updated CV is available here.

This website constitutes a personal experimental mechanism to hierarchically organize my thoughts, thus forcing myself to remain in a creative state of mind by improving my writing skills and developing a constant learning habit.

News

May 22, 2022 Joined Google as a Software Engineer. Moved to NY.
Oct 10, 2020 Started working as an Applied Research Scientist at Facebook Meta.
Jun 10, 2019 Our work with Robert Aduviri on disentagled representations was orally presented at the ICML 2019 LatinX in AI Research Workshop
May 6, 2019 Presented our work on node embeddings at the ICLR 2019 Representation Learning on Graphs and Manifolds Workshop
Feb 1, 2019 Won the ICLR 2019 Reproducibility Challenge for the ‘Variational Sparse Coding’ replication effort.
Dec 8, 2018 Poster presentation at NeurIPS 2018 LXAI Research Workshop
Jun 15, 2018 Succesfully finished first year of master program (Interview)
Sep 1, 2017 Started Statistical Learning Theory master program in Moscow.
Feel free to drop me a line at alfredo.delafuente.b {at} gmail. com
